page.title: 18FAUNA EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content: An open landscape where birds of arable land such as common and red legged partridge, lapwing and rook thrive. Yellow hammer, reed bunting and linnet can be found in the hedgerows with Kestrel and Sparrowhawk overhead. In thicker woodland cover summer migrants such as chiff chaff and willow warbler compete with residents wren, robin and dunnock. Egmanton Wood conceals mammals including foxes, badgers; hedgehogs and squirrels are more conspicuous. Cottage garden plants attract many butterflies _ clouded yellow, painted ladies, meadow brown and gatekeepers, small tortoise shell, red admiral and peacocks with wild bees.
